Fastapi project documentation¶

REST API main¶

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Confirms the user’s email address using the provided verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The token sent to the user’s email for verification.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying and updating the user’s status.

Returns:

A message indicating whether the email confirmation was successful.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the user is not found (status code 400).

async src.routes.auth.login(form_data: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Authenticates a user and returns an access token and refresh token.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The user’s login credentials.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException – If the credentials are invalid or the email is not confirmed (status code 401).

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Refreshes the user’s access token using the provided refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The current refresh token provided in the request header.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying and updating the user’s tokens.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the new access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid or does not match the one stored in the database (status code 401).

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Sends a confirmation email to the user if the email is not already confirmed.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The email address to send the confirmation to.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to handle sending the email asynchronously.

  • request (Request) – The request object used to retrieve the base URL for the confirmation email.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying.

Returns:

A message indicating that the confirmation email has been sent.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the user is not found (status code 404).

async src.routes.auth.request_password_reset(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Sends a password reset code to the user’s email if the account exists.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The email address associated with the user account.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to handle sending the reset email asynchronously.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying.

Returns:

A message indicating that the password reset code has been sent.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(body: ResetPassword, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Resets the user’s password using the provided reset code.

Parameters:

  • body (ResetPassword) – The email address, reset code, and new password for the user.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying and updating the user’s password.

Returns:

A message indicating that the password was successfully reset.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If the reset code or email is invalid (status code 400).

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserBase, request: Request, bt: BackgroundTasks, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session))¶

Registers a new user in the system.

Parameters:

  • body (UserBase) – The user data for registration.

  • request (Request) – The request object, used to retrieve the base URL for the confirmation email.

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – Background tasks to handle sending confirmation emails asynchronously.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session used for querying and committing changes.

Returns:

The newly created user, excluding the password.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the email is already registered (status code 409).

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactRead¶

Creates a new contact for the currently authenticated user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The contact data to be created.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactRead

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: UUID, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactRead¶

Deletes a specific contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (UUID) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or the user is not authorized to delete it.

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: UUID, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactRead¶

Retrieves a specific contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (UUID) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID.

Return type:

ContactRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or the user is not authorized to view it.

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: UUID, contact: ContactCreate, session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → ContactRead¶

Updates an existing contact with new data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (UUID) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The updated contact data.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found or the user is not authorized to update it.

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → UserResponse¶

Retrieves the currently authenticated user’s profile information.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The profile information of the current user.

Return type:

UserResponse

async src.routes.users.upload_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), session: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → dict¶

Uploads a new avatar image for the currently authenticated user and updates their profile.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to be uploaded.

  • session (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the URL of the uploaded avatar.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an error uploading the image or retrieving its URL.

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None) → str¶

Creates a new access token with an optional expiration delta.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[timedelta]) – Optional expiration time for the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict) → str¶

Creates a token for email verification.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT email verification token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str) → str¶

Decodes a refresh token and verifies its validity.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – The refresh token to decode.

Returns:

The email associated with the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an incorrect scope.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_async_session)) → User¶

Retrieves the current user based on the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The JWT token to decode and verify.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The User object associated with the token.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If credentials are invalid or the user is not found.

async get_email_from_token(token: str) → str¶

Extracts the email address from an email verification token.

Parameters:

token (str) – The email verification token to decode.

Returns:

The email address contained in the token.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or cannot be decoded.

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

Hashes a plain password.

Parameters:

password (str) – The plain text password to hash.

Returns:

The hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
async refresh_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None) → str¶

Creates a new refresh token with an optional expiration delta.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[timedelta]) – Optional expiration time for the token.

Returns:

The encoded JWT refresh token.

Return type:

str

verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool¶

Verifies a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends a verification email to the user with a confirmation token.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – The base URL of the application used in the email template.

Returns:

None

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue with the email server connection.
